question.body: The four main arteries carrying blood to the head are the __________.

multiple_choice.choice: superior thyroid artery, two middle cerebral arteries and the lingual artery
two posterior cerebral arteries, two anterior cerebral arteries
two brachiocephalic arteries and two carotid arteries
two carotid arteries and two vertebral arteries

response.feedback: Incorrect. Although the thyroid artery is in the neck, the middle cerebral arteries and the lingual artery are in the head. The vessels carrying blood to the head run through the neck.
Incorrect. These two sets of arteries are contained in the brain. The vessels supplying the head run through the neck.
Incorrect. There is only one brachiocephalic artery and it branches into multiple arteries, some of which supply the head.
Correct. The two carotid arteries and two vertebral arteries each carry blood superiorly through the neck to deliver it to the head.

part.hint: They are two sets of paired arteries that pass through the neck.
